Master of Social Work: Master of Social Work Rowan Universityâ€™s Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) Program provides specialized practice in mental health, equity and wellbeing. Additional graduate certification (COGS) options further transdisciplinary learning and practice. The two-year program requires a minimum of 59 credits with 900 hours of field work experience.

Electives: 9 s.h. The MSW requires a minimum of 9 elective credits. To enhance transdisciplinary learning, electives can be fulfilled through social work or other approved Rowan graduate courses from the certificate programs listed below.
MSW Approved Graduate Certificates (COGS: MSW Approved Graduate Certificates (COGS) Electives are designed to further transdisciplinary learning and students are encouraged to explore partner graduate programs and/or related disciplines. Students have the option to apply elective credits towards a related certificate in graduate study (COGS). Certificates are not a requirement for MSW degree completion and oversite is provided by the department/program offering the certificate. Rowan certificate programs that can count towards MSW elective credit include: Diversity & Inclusion Holocaust & Genocide Education Public Health Preparedness & Emergency Medical Management Public Policy Wellness Coaching
Certificate of Graduate Study in Diversi: Certificate of Graduate Study in Diversity & Inclusion: 12 s.h. For information regarding the COGS please visit Certificate of Graduate Study in Diversity & Inclusion
Certificate of Graduate Study in Holocau: Certificate of Graduate Study in Holocaust & Genocide Education: 12 s.h. For information regarding the COGS please visit Certificate of Graduate Study in Holocaust & Genocide Education.
Certificate of Graduate Study in Public: Certificate of Graduate Study in Public Health Preparedness & Emergency Medical Management: 12 s.h. For inormation regarding the COGS please visit Certificate of Graduate Study in Public Health Preparedness & Emergency Medical Management
Certificate of Graduate Study in Public Policy: 9 s.h. For information regarding the COGS please visit Certificate of Graduate Study in Public Policy
Certificate of Graduate Study in Wellnes: Certificate of Graduate Study in Wellness Coaching: 12 s.h. For information on the COGS please visit Certificate of Graduate Study in Wellness Coaching
Note:: Note: *Required Course Graduates are eligible for national certification from the National Board of Health and Wellness Coaches. Upon student request additional certificates (COGS) and/or graduate courses will be considered by the MSW Program Director on a case by case basis.

notes: Total Required Credits for the Program: 59 s.h. Foundation Courses None Graduation/Exit, Benchmark, and/or Thesis Requirements Completion of 900 hours of field education Minimum Required Grades and Cumulative GPA The Master of Social Work is a Category 3 program. For details regarding satisfactory academic progress and graduation requirements, please visit Academic Program Policy Categories.
